title: Can investors sue Neil Woodford to recoup their losses?
text:
Angry investors trapped in Neil Woodford’s Equity Income fund will be hoping to reclaim money they have lost through legal action or compensation.

The fund has been suspended since June, after large withdrawals had caused the amount it held in unlisted companies to come close to breaching regulations. Since then, investors have lost 15pc on their money, and many have told this newspaper that they fear losing chunks of their life savings or having to forget their retirement dreams.

Once the portfolio has been sold, investors are likely to receive a lot less than they initially put in, with some estimates as low as 60p for every £1 invested.

Following the removal of Mr Woodford as fund manager...
